38923506.review:
This game is the epitome of "difficult, but fair".

The controls are tight, the patterns are coherent and interesting, the levels have a good amount of internal consistency, and if you are a weeb like me, the music / waifus make it much less frustrating than most other hard games. That said, if you play on the hardest difficulty (which you should), it can take upwards of 500 attempts to get past certain segments without dying or bombing. It's still extremely fun, but not for the faint of heart.

38916442.review:
粉东方7、8年了，看到它登录的steam真是喜出望外。
不敢说自己有多么深粉，只知道自己曾经深爱过它。

作为一个老牌的弹幕游戏，素质方面着实不能小觑。
不过说实话这一作的力度，比起前代还是软了不少。

先说说出彩的地方：
不知道是不是神主嫌玩法少了，或者说以风神录为界，对游戏额外机制的依赖越来越重，当然这是好事情，毕竟增添了创新的玩法以及控制难度上也有了基础。
然后就是道中弹幕，说实话这一作的道中弹幕的演出非常的不错，尤其是1-4面，非常的不错，配合着不错的背景合适的音乐，代入很强，不过仅限于弹幕。
人设方面……虽然东方人物一代又一代的能力设定越来越让人摸不到头脑，但是以民俗学方面为原型一直是神主的强项，在文化输出方面真的有想法，顺便晒黑的琪露诺让我笑会。

再说说缺陷：
首先我要说弹幕的问题，我在优点里说道中弹幕很出彩是很有原因的，尤其表现在前三面的BOSS方面，总感觉欠了点什么。
机制方面还是有点鸡肋，使用不同组合机制会触发不同的效果，有个同样的效果就是消除周围的弹幕，这个效果基本可以顶一个小B，变相降低了收符卡的难度，有上限但使用率平衡……这一作摸奖很爽啊！
背景方面真的很背景了，还是很怀念风神录4面瀑布中窜出的小妖精，真的很令人陶醉。

来谈谈个人喜好：
弹幕方面，我喜欢5面双子的，压迫感很爽，经此而已，反而6面没这样的感觉，可能是两个人吧。
而且总有一种莫名的熟悉感，妖妖梦+地灵殿外带一点星莲船的组合？
音乐我喜欢2、3、4面道中曲，4、5、6面的boss曲。EX面道中和BOSS曲越来越不走心了，或者说设定风格偏于本土风俗文化导致曲风和旋律延展不开吧。
以我最喜欢的风神录和地灵殿做10分，整体质量8分，弹幕6分。
从2年的打磨时间来看，真的与绀珠传天差地别了。

推荐方面：
系列粉丝肯定不能放过，整体难度适合新人开荒和老人练手。
一般的弹幕游戏玩家也可以以适中难度向上挑战。
希望东方的圈子越来越壮大，粉丝们也别被二设冲昏了正直的头脑。

闲言：
弹幕游戏本身属于小众游戏，当然不是指受众面，而是创作方面，玩法让游戏的瓶颈越来越多，创新的突破真的不易，从神灵庙开始，我内心就时常觉得神主已是江郎才尽，现实或许也是如此，不过这个系列可以一直延续到现在，真的是一个奇迹，如它本身一样。
全作的弹幕系都有深有浅的接触过，只是盗版成为了心中的坎儿，这一次就算是自我救赎的第一步吧，是时候为了曾经的年少轻狂而买账了。

38745511.review:
The manliest game about fairies and little girls you can buy.

Always liked Touhou , but never really bothered much with them because you had to resort to the *under the router" method of aquiring them, since they are only sold at Comiket (japanese convention I think). And then when you get it, it might not even work. I have a physical cd of imperishable night but it didin't even work past the first time I played it  and I had to *cough* ARRRRRRRGH! MATEY *cough* the game to get a working version anyway.  But now it finally looks like we can actually start buying the games.  I want to bring up too the fact that the game probably only has "overwhelmingly positive" feedback because 99% of the people here already like them and knew what it was beforehand.  It's a decently made bullet hell  crafted by a single drunken japanese man about little girls and fairies  that shoot laser bullets, with the world's most obnoxiously productive fanbase.  While most anime fans do nothing but whine and complain on the internet about stupid shit, the Touhou fanbase will find you, beat you in the back alley and write an album consisting of samples sourced from your screaming in agony, and cries of tormented pain. You don't fuck with the Touhou fanbase.   

Also there's not really much of a language barrier since it's bullet hell, and you can find an explanation  the scoring mechanics online, but there's an english patch here. https://www.thpatch.net/wiki/Touhou_Patch_Center:Download

38668139.review:
Primero que nada, estoy muy agradecido porque Zun por fin trajo un juego de esta hermosa saga, sin dudarlo lo compre para apoyar el trabajo de este buen hombre. 

Respecto al juego y la saga en general, siempre han sido desafiantes, solo he podido aguantar la dificultad Hard, la Lunatic es para los dioses. Este Touhou en especial es buen comienzo para adrentarse a la saga, no es de los más dificiles, es muy disfrutable.

La banda sonora siempre ha sido de lo mejor de Touhou, en particular me encanta, es un placer el escuchar esas melodías  y hacen aún mejor disfrutable el juego.

El nivel extra en este Touhou me gusta bastante, como siempre, es un gran desafío, pero necesitas ser más rápido, reaccionar más rápido, ampliar tu línea de visión y siempre ver que esta pasanda más aya de donde esta tu personaje, eso me fascinó, siempre uso más el slow para no morir tan seguido, pero aquí, al menos en el trasncurso del nivel, casi no es necesario.

Amo esta saga, a sus personajes, su música, sus niveles, es mi favorita de toda la vida.

Denle una oportunidad, es Touhou, que más necesitas saber para adquirirlo xD

38657503.review:
Many people play the Touhou Games for a reason:
-Some want the challenge
-Some want to find out more about the world
-And some just adore the music

How I got into the Games was via the Music way:

When I was young I found some MIDI on Youtube labeled "Death Waltz".
It was some weird song, which I thought was quite good.
Later I discovered, that this song was a remix of the song "u.n owen was her" from Touhou 6.
After listening to countless tracks, I decided to give these games a try.
And that's how I found my way to the Touhou Project.

Concerning this game.
It is the 16th game of the series.
And the music is just as perfect as ever.
As is the gameplay, and so on.

If you loved the other games of the series, I don't think I have to tell you, but this one is worth your time, too.

38449358.review:
Finally, after years of prowling the Touhou community, i can purchase a game on Steam.

All you need to know, though certainly not my favorite game in the series, HSiFS is certainly good enough, and challenging enough and interesting enough to spark the curiosity of anyone who either,

A) Love japanese games, or game inspired by Asian culture and mythology

or

B) like to have an actual challange trying to beat a game, this game is certainly not a walk in the park though perhaps the easiest in the series.

Why should you consider buying this title? or even looking into the series itself?
+The music is top-notch as always.
+Nice difficulty curve.
+Better than any western-cancerous games that you will find on steam *Cough* Undertale *Cough*
+A community that truly makes the games shine with fan-works
+AUNN

Reasons to perphaps not try this specific game in the series.
-The easiest one yet.
-The difficulty really shoots up after the first three stages.
-Perphaps the easiest final boss ever.
-The return of the unfortunately most loved character in the series, but in a tanned form.

A personal pet peeve that should in no way influence your decision to play this game.
The inclusion of said tanned character, with no relation to the season she represents in game. instead of the character who literally has "Flower Master of the Four Seasons" in one of her titles.

More reasons to consider the game
To give beer money to Lord ZUN
AUNN, JUST BUY THE GAME FOR HER ALREADY!

Basically, if you are new to the Touhou game series, this would make a decent place to start ( as compared to the sixth game) because of the nice learning curve and difficulty, that is in no way easy by conventional means, is easy in the terms of a Touhou game. You will no doubt love most, if not all of the stage and boss themes. Lastly, as with all Touhou games, only being loosely connected from game to game, with only the last few games feeling directly connected because of the fighting games that come between the main games, and the manga, you do not need to play and of the previous titles to enjoy the characters or the story, but if you want to play the previous games, just skip the sixth game, the undertale of this game series. Also, feeling the need to start from the begining will not go well without preparation, as the 1st to the 5th game require an old Japanese operating system emulator and are unable to be played on Windows, Linux or whatever operating system you use.

38374039.review:
While Touhou 16 (東方天空璋 ～ Hidden Star in Four Seasons), the first of the series to come to Steam despite being the 25th currently released entry to the Touhou Project series, is not my favorite game title of the series, but is part of one of my favorite game series of all time. It's not for everyone, so this review is targeted for those jumping into the world of Gensokyo for the very first time.

First of all, let me say that if you are trying this game for the first time, play the game on Easy. This is not one of those games that's beginner friendly on Normal, and the Easy difficult is [i]designed[/i] for people who have never played a Shoot 'em Up (shump) genre game before, and even if you have, Touhou's different enough from the genre to warrant an Easy playthrough to see what you're getting into. To put it as the YouTuber NakaTeeleli did: "Easy is hard, Normal is really freaking hard, Hard is tearing-your-hair-out hard, and Lunatic is... actually quite fitting." This is essentially Touhou in a nutshell for many beginners.

There is a dedicated English patching program out there found [url=https://www.thpatch.net/wiki/Touhou_Patch_Center:Download]here[/url] and it's what I will be judging the dialogue of the game on (also good to read the in-game manual with). Simply put, the genre of the game makes dialogue and story really simple and straight-forward, sometimes leaving meanfulness behind. Even with the four different characters to choose from, dialogue is quick, straight forward, frank, and even blunt at times. The game has a story prologue found in the physical manual of the game, but is translated [url=https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hidden_Star_in_Four_Seasons/Story/Prologue]here[/url], and gives some intro insight into the game's story proper if you get into it English patched so you aren't totally lost in the narative.

Those four characters to choose from are based on the various seasons, and each character has their own choice of four sub-shot types also based on seasons. This gives the game variety in shot types, but as many who play this game can tell you, certain combos are better than others, so a good way to get a feel for each shot type is to play each character with their sub-shot matching their respective season. Gameplay basically consists of many mostly slow projectiles attacks (referred to in the series as "danmaku") woven in intricate patterns requiring players to dodge in a various manor of ways with some being static patterns, projectiles aimed at your position, or a mixture of both. In-game, your player character's hitbox (shown by pressing Shift if you're using keyboard controls) must not get hit by the danmaku projectiles or you will lose a life.

Difficulty curbes in the later half of the six stages outside of the unlockable Extra Stage which is unlocked upon a full clear of those stages. In-game, you start with a set of two lives (represented by hearts, more gained by scoring at values under the hearts), three bombs (represented by stars), 1.00 Power (maxes at 4.00 w/ "P" items), 10,000 point's score value (represented as "点" items), and the last value being "Graze" which increases when a danmaku projectile passes close by your character (having more multiplies score the more you graze). The goal the game sets is for players to clear the game without running out of all your lives by the end of stage six. While you can continue after a game over, which is highly recommended for practice, beating the game under a continue results in a Bad Ending, so the goal is to get the Good Ending across the multiple difficulties. Don't expect to beat the game your first try difficulty go because a lot of the game has pattern memorization that's really needed for some attacks, so make use of those Practice and Spell Practice modes; they're a [b]godsend[/b] in overcoming some of the difficult hurdles every player faces. Easy to understand as this is, this game is still very difficult, and I mean [i]REALLY[/i] difficult. It may take you years of practice to reach a high difficulty levels. For some folks this kind of struggle isn't worth it, but for others, myself included, getting to that level of skill is one of the most thrilling/rewarding/gratifying gaming experiences out there today. It is for this reason I highly recommend playing the Touhou Project series, more than just this game too; there are entries out there, and all have their own mechanics, quirks, and charms!

To close this review piece, one of the major things to note about this game is the music. While many will say with good reason that [i]all[/i] the games, even the first five games back in the NEC PC-9801 system have great music, this game's score in particular is considered exceptionally great, and a wonderful listening experience (even as I write this review, I'm listening to music in the in-game music room!). Touhou is the kind of game with such memorable music. It's spawned a phenomenon in game music alone with millions of fan arrangements. The music of the original games is still music that has such a stand-out unique style to it, and is brilliantly composed. Even if the game isn't for you, it's very worth your time to hear the soundtrack to this game and the rest of the series. Seriously, [b]GO LISTEN TO THE TOUHOU PROJECT'S MUSIC, IT IS SO OUTSTANDING.[/b]

I very highly recommend playing the Touhou Project series if it's your cup of tea. You can actually buy a physically copy of the game also, but if you buy it on Steam, it's more direct support to the series' creator Jun'ya Ota (who goes by the pseudonym ＺＵＮ). This series is not only prolific with plenty of games to its name, but the mainline series of shump games are made exclusively by ZUN; he acts as a one-man team which gives these game a true charm for they are games he wanted to truly make. The series has also a fair share of fighting games if you're a fan of those games handled by Twilight Frontier, too (東方憑依華　～ Antinomy of Common Flowers by them is coming to Steam too!). The creator has inspired so many where he not only made the game's engine and programming by himself from scratch, but also composed, drew, wrote, and tested (sometimes with help) the games he made all by himself. He's also a successful story writer who has written one fiction novel, nine amazing official comics spanning of four series, two short stories and comics (as bonus material to his works) and 6 artbooks. While all the art in this literature from artists brough on to help (two of which have their art featured in official games). The fact that ZUN's influence has allowed for artist to speak their wonderful personal stories of working with ZUN and how great it is to work with him, it speaks [i]volumes[/i] on the influence ZUN has had on people with his series.

ZUN's works has changed lives and inspired countless fan contributed work all of which ZUN allows under his series' [url=https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Touhou_Wiki:Copyrights#Copyright_status.2FTerms_of_Use_of_the_Touhou_Project]Terms of Use[/url]). He helped popular fan games come to consoles like the Playstation 4 and the Nintendo Switch, and set wonderful attitude towards fan works that game designers of today should absolutely take notes on. The Touhou Project is more than just a game series folks, it is a varitable phenomenon the likes of which this review will never do full justice.

With that all said, I hope you enjoy Touhou. Its creator is my personal hero, and I'd like to thank him, the people that work with him, the fans that asked Touhou to come to Steam, for the success this game alone has had on Steam, the Touhou Patchers who keep releasing English patches to enjoy, the Touhou Wiki (that I linked to) for being such a fantastic resource for all information Touhou, a good friend who helped me proofread this review, and to the fellow fans who enjoy Touhou with me.

Thank you in advance for the reading my first review, folks! Have fun playing Touhou! ^^

38306107.review:
Alright Touhou has made it to steam and our lord and savior ZUN can finally get our money...

But let's be serious here and start the actual review:

As you may or may not know touhou games are known for their masterpiece like music, characters, story, references to eastern folk lore and difficulty so I will be listing how well touhou 16 does in being a main touhou game.

Story: Once again there is an incident and the heroines must figure out who is causing it and stop them which is the basic formula for all touhou stories.

Characters: You can play as 4 different characters and choose 4 different sub seasons with their own perks which makes this game excellent at giving options to play with. Some bosses are also very interesting with their abilities and importance to the overall story.

Music: I love most of the tracks in this game and all the tracks in the game are very good for touhou standards. I just feel like the Concealed Four Seasons is a pretty weak final boss theme but the extra stage one is absolutely amazing.

References: Pretty much all of the characters and places in this game have a reference to something so I will just let you figure those out by yourself.

Difficulty: Extra stage is too easy but stages 5 and 6 are extremely punishing on lunatic to make it a hard game.

Overall: It is a solid addition to the main touhou games list and is unique enough to stand on it's own.

Also if you don't know how to look for an english patch or setup your keybinds you are pretty bad at using a computer in general.

38142812.review:
I'll be one who, like everyone else, will tell you that Touhou is an amazing series. But Hidden Star in Four Seaons is one of the best Touhou has to offer, and I'll tell you why I think so:

ZUN couldn't have picked a better game for Touhou's debut on Steam, it's challenging, but not too challenging that a beginner couldn't easily pick the game up and learn quickly. It's difficulty is fairly balanced all the way through. A great addition to the series in this game is the "release" subshot system, it gives a whole new spin on player shot types and adds a neat little layer of replayability by mix and matching characters with seasons, not to mention a handy dandy extra little bomb in it's own sense. It's not even worth mentioning how amazing Touhou's music always is, but ZUN always manages to go bigger and better, improving his musical style with each game while giving them all their own unique style and atmosphere. The art, everyone can agree is objectively "not good", but it's important to also look at how much ZUN has steadily improved in art, and it's always has its own cute charm to it no matter what you think of the quality. Along those lines the character designs are wonderful, they're all so lively and colourful and really reflect each season they're about. The story (if you can find translations) is simple, but really good, details hidden in plain sight and a really interesting villain to tie it all together.

All in all a wonderful addition to the Touhou series that I'm happy to own on Steam, I highly recommend it for new comers and those returning to the series. And remember everyone, always watch your back.

38129703.review:
개인적으로 동방의 전성기를 뽑자면 성련선이나 천칙이 나온 직후를 뽑을 수 있지요.
하지만 동방 음악에 있어서는 이미 한참전에 완성이 되어있었습니다.
홍마향에서 요요몽 그리고 영야초로 넘어가는 과정에서 비록 1년주기로 발매되었지만 음악은 아주 크게 변화하였습니다.
홍마향에서는 고전게임풍의 전자음악이 주를 이루었다면 영야초를 보면 거의다 금관, 목관악기 그리고 소수의 현악기와 타악기 음악으로 이루어진 순수한 음악이라는 느낌이 나게 되었고 가장 가슴을 울리고 또 완성도 또한 높았습니다.
이는 화영총과 그 앞 작품들의 동일한 곡을 비교하면 알 수 있는데, 요요몽에서 가장 최전성기의 동방곡 형태가 잘 드러나는 유령악단만 해도 화영총에서는 다듬어진 느낌을 확 느낄 수 있는 반면 영야초의 곡들은 화영총의 곡과 별반 차이가 없어졌고 그 느낌은 그대로 성련선까지 전해졌습니다.
흔히 싸구려 트럼펫 소리라고 하지만 감성의 마천루의 인트로 부분에서 들리는 금관악기 소리는 동방음악의 최정점을 나타내주었고 처음 듣는이라고 할지라도 심금을 울리면서 청자를 압도하는 느낌을 나게 하였습니다. 그리고 이러한 곡의 완성도는 명실상부한 동방의 전성기를 이루어내었고 성련선이 발매되는 코믹마켓에서 동방프로젝트 부스는 최고조에 이르게 되었습니다.
하지만 신령묘로 이어지는 3부작에 와서는 그 느낌이 점점 없어지고 기계음이 다시 돌아오고있는듯한 느낌이 들어 안타까웠습니다.
비록 아직도 퓨어 프리즈 같은 걸출한 명곡들이 등장하기는 하나 영야초의 기승전결과 섬세함, 웅장함을 다 보여주지는 못하는 것 같아서 참 아쉽습니다.
그래도 6년이라는 세월동안 저의 일부 이상이 되어준 이 명작들에게 저는 너무나도 감사함을 느끼고 있습니다.
그리고 제가 제일 좋아하는 게임인 이 작품들이 다시한번 전성기를 맞이해서 더 많은 사람들이랑 같이 즐길 수 있었으면 좋겠습니다.
마지막으로 동방 프로젝트 작품이 이렇게 스팀으로 나와서 더 많은 사람들이 동방을 접할 수 있게 되어 너무나도 기쁩니다.

38066491.review:
Touhou 16 Hidden Star in Four Seasons es un juego bullet hell, también conocido como el género danmaku. Es un juego estilo arcade, donde tu personaje avanzará en una pantalla vertical a través de diferentes zonas en el desarrollo de la historia.

Al tratarse de un juego género bullet hell, la gracia del mismo reside en que tendrás que esquivar muchas, muchas, muchas y muchas (¿he dicho ya muchas?) balas mágicas, de diferentes formas, tamaños y colores. 
Muchas veces se te presentarán diferentes patrones que tendrás que esquivar o gastar algún recurso (tal como la liberación de la estación o una bomba) para escapar ileso.

En este juego tienes cuatro personajes: cada uno de ellos representa una de las cuatro estaciones del año. Dependiendo del personaje que escojas, tendrás un disparo diferente: una de las chicas tiene un disparo teledirigido, aunque hace poco daño, mientras que otra tiene un rayo muy potente que tendrás que dirigir para dar en el blanco. Además, cada personaje tiene distintas velocidades de movimiento: hay algunas más rápidas y otras más lentas.

Sin embargo, cada Touhou se diferencia del anterior por las diversas y curiosas opciones de disparo que te permiten elegir, además del poder que ya posee el personaje principal. En este juego, la segunda opción de disparo son las estaciones. Por ejemplo, puedes usar a Reimu (quien tiene la primavera) y usar como subpoder el verano. Como tal, el subpoder posee una característica especial: puedes liberar la estación (gastar el poder de la misma) para poder activar un efecto único que depende de la que lleves equipada. Este juego de llevar dos estaciones (pudiendo elegir la misma estación dos veces) le da mucha versatilidad a la partida, ya que se te permite experimentar de muchas formas para que descubras la opción que más se adapta a tu gusto.

En cuanto a la banda sonora, es muy bonita. ZUN nos fascina siempre con nuevos temas musicales para sus juegos (al igual que su sorprendente dibujo, el cual nunca es igual que en el juego anterior), y este caso no es ninguna excepción.
El apartado musical depende del gusto del jugador, pero en mi caso diré que esta banda sonora gana de paliza a su predecesora (Touhou 15: Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom).

En el menú principal puedes practicar cualquier fase del juego a la que hayas llegado, para superarla en el modo historia con más facilidad. Además, hay otra sección donde puedes practicar los patrones más difíciles para superarlos sin gastar tantos recursos. Como se dice, la práctica hace al maestro.

Estos dos menús vienen muy bien a la hora de completar la historia, ya que si completas el modo historia en NORMAL, DIFÍCIL o LUNÁTICO, sin que te quiten todas las vidas (sin usar un continue para que te devuelvan más vidas), desbloquearás el modo extra, un apartado adicional a la historia original del juego.  Huelga decir que las Spell Cards (los patrones) del modo extra también podrás practicarlos en el menú del mismo nombre.

Bajo mi punto de vista, el juego es muy bueno. Te da las oportunidades para conseguir nuevas vidas y Spell Cards/Bombas, tiene una dificultad justa (me pasé el modo normal y ando practicando en el Extra), digna de la saga, no demasiado fácil ni demasiado difícil; buena banda sonora, muchas opciones de disparos para escoger la que más te guste, y muuchos reintentos para conseguir la satisfacción personal de completar la historia.

Sin más, recomiendo la compra del juego a cualquier amante de la saga Touhou Project. No sólo apoyamos a ZUN, el creador de la saga, a que traiga más, sino que apoyamos a la propia saga a que sea más conocida y que se distribuya más por territorio occidental.

38046349.review:
I have been a long time fan of the Touhou series, for the beautiful bullet patterns, cute girls, friendly difficulty and occasionally memorable sound tracks. And of course the shock and awe when you find out that everything is made by one person who drinks too much beer. And now it's finally on Steam for everyone to buy properly.

Just like any other bullet hell game, Touhou Tenkuushou has to have a signature mechanic unique to the game, aside from shooting and spellcards (spellcards are basically bombs in the Touhou universe). This time it's the seasons: certain actions spawn season items, you collect them to gain slightly better firepower, and can also release them as mini-spellcards.

Personally I quite like this mechanic, because it provides me with additional tools to defend myself with, and doesn't require too much of my attention. Traditionally the only way out of crises is to use a spellcard, which is incredibly powerful but you have to pray for refills as they don't come very frequently. In Tenkuushou however, you have a second choice of releasing season power. Sure it is less powerful, but it refills really fast, and you can collect season items blindly just like any other item. As a contrast, some mechanics from other games in the series either require too much attention, or just outright work against me. I'm looking at you, human-youkai gauge from Touhou Eiyashou and UFOs from Touhou Seirensen.

Other than the seasons mechanic, Touhou Tenkuushou doesn't really feel different from previous games. I do find it even more difficult to tell items from bullets, and bullets from the background, but that might be just me.

To those not familiar, please remember that the Touhou series is entirely made by one person, and has never been seriously commercial. It's only natural that they have inferior graphics and sound compared to commercial bullet hell games. However, Touhou does take a slightly different approach, emphasizing the beauty of bullet patterns instead of a sheer overall difficulty. It's also set in a unique fantasy world called Gensokyo, where everyone looks like a maiden. It's definitely worth looking into.

+ Vibrant graphics
+ Lovable characters in a fantasy setting
+ Beautiful bullet patterns
+ Season power
+ Wide span of difficulty
- Mediocre music
- Bullets don't stand out enough

8 out of 10, excellent.

38003653.review:
Hidden Star in Four Seasons may be my new 3rd favourite Touhou game, right behind everybody's darlings Imperishable Night and Perfect Cherry Blossom.
What makes it so good, apart from generally fun and clever pattern design, has to be the release system. Hitting C on the keyboard activates an effect that can be described as a "soft-bomb". This ability needs to be charged, but can help you in a pinch and won't even forfeit a Spell Card capture bonus. Smart combinations of soft-bombs and the more valuable series staple Spell Cards (your "hard-bomb") can get you a long way just through strategy rather than relying only on your full-on dodging skills. Putting your resources to good use feels immensely satisfying, more than e.g. Ten Desire's Trance Mode.
The difficulty of the game is slightly below average among other installments of the franchise, which is not at all a bad thing to me. Some Touhou games have been too tough for me to enjoy as much as this. Hidden Star in Four Seasons was in my eyes a great choice as poster boy for ZUN's Steam debut.
Lastly, I can't end this review without at least some amount of 2hu shitposting: When in Japan and you see a Jizo statue, don't try to enter its back door. It is unpious and it will get you arrested for indecency.

37936303.review:
Touhou returns in a classic yet always fresh take on the well-known format. Bringing with it a selection of 4 playable characters, each with unique bullet patterns, spell cards and other quirks, the player can choose from the classic protagonists Reimu and Marisa or choose from either the ever favourable tengu Aya Shameimaru or Cirno, sporting a glowing tan. The difficulty remains fair yet challenging, with each stage requiring memory, skill and patience to pass successfully. The music is diverse and evocative, and certainly deserves a place among the already revered Touhou soundtracks of the past (most notably the theme for stage 4). The bosses are unique and all equally daunting, but once you being to progress you begin to realise how easily you can surpass each one, despite their spell cards being a worthy hurdle to overcome, and one that you may fall flat on your face over many times.

Overall it's hard to fault yet another stellar entry to the immortal Touhou series, as ZUN continues to put his heart, soul and physical years of his life into his single-handedly crafted masterpieces.

English patches are available through Touhou fan sources so for those who can't read Japanese I would recommend making use of those.

37934220.review:
Ceux qui connaissent déjà Touhou doivent se douter que Hidden Star in Four Seasons est aussi génial que ses prédécesseurs, ce qui est le cas.

On pourrait très bien s'arrêter là, mais je suis presque sûr que certains ici vont découvrir cet univers grâce à Steam. Alors, il est de mon devoir en tant qu'adepte de Touhou de retenir votre attention et d'initier votre curiosité envers Gensokyo et ses mystères!

Alors, qu'est-ce que ca donne? Et bien, nous avons ici un magnifique Danmaku (un shoot'em up japonais) extrêmement difficile. D'ailleurs, il s'agit du point fort de la franchise, deumeurant à la base de son succès: Touhou est l'un des jeux les plus durs au monde (oui-oui, Dark Souls parait pour du pipi de chat à côté). Il est donc totalement normal de perdre quand on est débutant, mais également en tant qu'habitué ou même pro! Le but du jeu consistera donc principalement à éviter un nombre incalculable de "bullets" se frôlant déjà à partir du mode Normal (la 2e difficulté sur 4!).

L'histoire que l'on suit n'est pas extraordinaire, mais les dialogues entre les personnages remplissent parfaitement les quelques secondes de répit offertes en plein niveau tout en nous informant sur ce qui se passe. Les personnages sont toutes aussi attachantes (protagonistes comme antagonistes) et possèdent toutes, sans exception, une personnalité qui leur est propre. Le tout agrémenté de la musique toujours aussi superbe et originale depuis les tout premiers opus, nous avons une expérience enrichissante pouvant mêler détente et concentration.

Si vous êtes toujours là, alors c'est que vous êtes vraiment intéressé par l'univers de Touhou, et plus particulièrement par ce dernier volet de la série de jeu. Le moment est donc enfin venu de vous le dire:
Foncez! N'hésitez pas! Profitez de cette expérience magique! Et ouvrez-vous ensuite à ce magnifique univers qui n'attend que vous!

37922227.review:
Alright Twowhos on steam and I have played an entire .5 hours of it, but lemme try and make a review anyways since I've played way more than .5 hours of this from the usual place I get Touhou games.

Art: 6/10
I mean its ZUN the mans good at pretty much everything but art, I mean he's a better artist than me, and I can tell that the blobs of art in the game are supposed to represent cute anime grills, so its good enough.

Graphics: 8.5/10
So while the character portraits arent very good, the sprites in this game are actually pretty good, and the bullet patterns are fantastic, but thats just common place for a Touhou game.

Story: 0/10 if you dont speak nintendo, 7.5/10 if you get the english patch
it has a story, I dont really know much about 16 because I'm a bit brain dead and havent really looked into the story of HSiFS yet, but it seems neat from what I can read.

Music: 9.5/10
Its Touhou, if you dont know what a Touhou is then you've probably either heard of the music or the difficulty atleast, and lemme tell you; the music in this game is phenominal, its not my favourite Touhou ost, but its pretty great still and out of the 18~ track long ost there are only like 2 songs that i dont enjoy listening to whenever.

Gameplay: 8.5/10
Now if you live under a tree infested with mutant animals in Chernobyl and dont know what a shmup is, then I guess I'll explain a bit of that too. A shmup (Shoot em' up) is a bullet hell type game where you shoot down enemys coming at you, there is usually some sort of bomb mechanic that can clear a screen and deal massive damage to enemy weakspots. Shmups usually have 5-8 stages but some will have less or more. Touhou 16 Hidden Star in Four Seasons is a shmup with the unique Touhou feel to it, and also a mechanic called a release (*cough* Len'en *cough*) which is pretty much a free, easy to get, weaker bomb. There are 4 different releases in the game all with different mechanics, all of which have their own advantages and disadvantages and I think its a fun mechanic that balances out well (cirno release is best release tho). Touhou games are usually 6 stages long with 1 extra stage if you really wanna bash your head against a wall, and that stays true for this game. As far as characters go there are 4 choices: 
Aya: who has a bomb that stays out for a while, giving you long I frames, and a decent damage shot with wide unfocused spread and tight focused spread
Cirno: who has an "OK" bomb that is a big circle on the screen staying out for a bit less than ayas bomb, and who has I think the worst damage in the game, but an alright shot type aiming wise.
Reimu: who is a good starter for beginners to Touhou, she has good basic bomb, and an ok damage shot that homes in on enemys
Marisa: who is the best girl, Marisa has the highest damage and my favourite bomb, which is just a huge friggin laser that wipes out anything in its path, her shot type while dealing the most damage, is probably the most narrowly spread though.
All of those characters can be good for whatever your playstyle is and all their releases can be mixed between characters for whichever character/release combo you want. Now that I've talked about all that, lets get into something pretty important; the difficulty. Touhou 16 is probably the overall easiest Touhou game, probably due to the releases and most of the boss attacks in the game being fairly easy compared to the other games, there are 4 difficultys though, so if your having an easy time with normal mode, move up to hard or even lunatic if your actually crazy, and if your having a hard time, then go down to easy modo, which im sure you wont be made fun of for playing. But those difficulties are only for the base 6 stages, the extra stage only has one difficulty, which I have heard people say that extra stages are usually compared to lunatic mode but I dont get that at all, so lets say that extra mode is more comparable to hard mode but its  1 stage with an extra hard boss at the end.

Overall: 8.5/10
A pretty good Touhou game, but definitely not the best, if your new to Touhou this game would be a good place to start because of how easy it is compared to other Touhous, but after you get the hang of being decent at the game, it would certainly benefit you to look into some of the other games, as I believe most of the PC touhou games are better than this one.

37919985.review:
Just going to start off with this because it only being released in Japanese might set some people off from the game, there should be guides around the internet to make your playing experience more enjoyable, and also an English patch.

I'm also going to say that this probably not the best review to go off from because this is from the perspective from someone who, while plays the game quite often, hasn't mastered or even beat it yet. I am not a Touhou fanatic in any shape or form, but I do love the gameplay. What I mostly played is EoSD, a bit of LoLK (of course I reset over 100 times in Pointdevice Mode…), and this. I am also quite a newcomer to the franchise, only really starting to play this year. This is also the first real review I've ever done, so that keep that in mind.

While my current time tracked on Steam is rather... low, I actually started playing this game ever since the game got posted online (of course I was a pirate too), so my time in this game is probably past eight to ten hours or so. I even played this game in the computer lab during school hours with my now broken USB, and well, the ICT teacher didn't care much. This is also the first Touhou game I was really hooked into, my first one was EoSD, but HSiFS was the one that made me love the franchise even more.

But back to the main point, Hidden Star in Four Seasons is the 16th (technically not really the  16th due to the other games that are numbered in-between) official Touhou game, and the first one to be put on Steam. While I'd talk about the series here, I'm not a Touhou historian and there are a million other people who can explain it better than be in the internet. But by the screenshots, it's a game where you dodge bullets while shooting your enemies. There are four difficulties, but I usually stay in the lower half because I'm not the best player in this.

There are four characters, each representing a different season. Their type and range of attacks and speed are different per character, and while it can be fun to use different characters, I personally like using Marisa (representing Winter) the most due to her speed. There are also sub-seasons, which also represent the four seasons (obviously), and can be used to complement a season's strength or add a bit more variety into your play, all with different sub-shots that in a way, represent the respective character for that season's abilities. 

If you feel like you're close to being absolutely cornered, you can use a bomb, but you will lose your bonus during a boss' spell card. You can also press C to release the season you collected, effects of course, depending on the sub-season chosen. This will also remove a varying amount of bullets from the screen.

There are four different difficulties, and in my opinion, while some people may think otherwise, choose the one that you are most comfortable with at first. While frustrating at first, once you start getting the hang of it, it's a lot of fun and well, addicting. Sometimes you may end up realizing that you spent more time than you thought playing the game. There are many enemies with different patterns and tricks up their sleeve, and being able to overcome them also, well, brings that good feeling of success.

While sure, not everyone is really a person who wants to try again and again to win, and to be honest, even I am a sore loser. But playing again and again (I'm not really a person to use continues, bombs, or season releases because I guess my mind is just not used to doing so.) and being able to succeed is just so satisfying. I'm more of a person who plays Touhou on and off, so I'm not really a person who plays in the higher difficulties, but I still get that good feeling even in the smallest successes in the game.

And while the character art can be... off putting to some, I personally don't really have a problem with it, and in fact, I kind of like it. The real art here anyway is the art of bullets, and still as gorgeous as ever from what I've seen throughout the series. The music is a charm to listen to, and it really adds more to the fight itself in my opinion, and is really a part what made me love the game even if I really suck at it. Sometimes it just doesn't feel the same at all without hearing the music while playing in the school's computer lab.

To be honest, aside from the frustration of losing and losing and losing all over again, there's nothing I really even dislike about HSiFS. Maybe it's different for those who played more games in the franchise, but coming from someone like me who doesn't play that often, I don't really have anything negative to say about it. Apparently there are bugs left over from the original release, but I have yet to encounter them myself.

Major props to ZUN for the everything, really shows he did so much for the franchise and still is, despite it being since what, the mid-1990's since he started working on Touhou. Many people had to pirate Touhou in the past, and with the public's reaction to HSiFS' Steam release now, hopefully in the future we continue to get more Touhou titles via Steam (maybe even some titles of the past too) in the future, maybe with even more Steam-related features.

So in a nutshell: Hard, yet fun, addicting with great music, will suck away so many hours of your life without even realizing it, but will feel so satisfying to get the hang of it. I definitely recommend you to get it, and while this might not be a game for everyone, it could be one for you… especially when the addiction gets to you. Seriously. Only not recommended for those who aren’t really into it or can’t handle the sheer difficulty.

37904048.review:
Where to start?
Well, let's start with "I love Touhou", so we all know how biased this review is.
Now, I shall talk about pros.
The release system, while making scoring trivial (according to some hardcore fans), does make the game much more friendly for newcomers.
The music, while it doesn't exceed expectations, doesn't dissapoint either. I feel it fits in the game well.
I like most newly introdused characters. I can't quite understand Eternity, but I don't hate her either.
That said, this game has its flaws.
Bullets tend to be obscured by background, falling items or sometimes even your own options (Marisa's lasers are way too shiny). It doesn't happen all that often though.
There are some bugs left over from comiket version.
Overrall, I realy like this game. I think it's very nice addition to the series and hope ZUN brings other games to Steam as well. If you are Touhou fan - you probably already have this game. If you are newcomer - Touhou 16 is nice place to start.

37864506.review:
Disclaimer: This User does not play many Touhou games, and the most experience this user has had is with EoSD

To keep things short and simple, this marks the first time Touhou has seen a release on Steam (and I want to say a Western release, but I don't think this is teachnically true).

Touhou games at their core are fairly basic shoot-em-ups, but in play, you'll find yourself practicing over and over again trying to beat the games absolutely dazzling spectacles of a boss fight without a single bullet hitting your hitbox.

This game is really not for those without any sense of patience or any desire to put hours into a game just to learn the ins and outs of a level, the patterns of attacks in every boss, and so forth. But to those looking for a challenge, this is a game for you.

Asides from its gameplay though, you will find yourself accompanied by some really spectacular jams as you fly through levels and sweat bullets trying not to die. So there's that too.

Art wise, ZUN could probably do with a sit in at one of Betty Edwards "Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain" lessons they usually do worldwide. Or just read the book.

In any case, I am absolutely excited to see this game on Steam and hope to see more Touhou, either ZUN's or from the doujin community at large, soon

37841588.review:
The 16th numbered game, 25th in the series, and first of them on Steam, Touhou: Hidden Star in Four Seasons is a top down, vertical-scrolling bullet hell shooter, much like Mushihimesama or the Danmaku Unlimited series.

While I can't say for certain whether or not this is the easiest of the bunch, I can say it is a good starting point to jump into, given some of the mechanics.  You can not only practice stages you've reached (as opposed to having to clear the stage first, as in previous games), you can even practice against specific spell cards (ie, the big moves done by the various bosses of the game), making it easier to learn That One Attack that keeps screwin' you over.

Another nice thing is the sub-season item pick-ups, which can act as a mini-bomb, either helping you escape a tight spot, or get you a nice bonus to your score.  But unlike bombs, you can use them during an enemy's spell card and still capture it (netting you a nice bonus, which can get you more lives).

I've yet to beat this game, but I've enjoyed it, and I hope to see more of the series come over this way.  With any luck, so will the soundtracks.

It's a good game. Not the best, but pretty darn great. Feels good to not pirate Touhou for once. I'd gladly buy more in the future.

The gameplay is fun. The music is rocking. The plot is enough. The art... well, in the wise words of some random redditor:

"Touhou is made by one man who sold his art skills to the devils for music skills"

It shows on both ends of that spectrum. Don't play this game for the art. Play it because it's the first Touhou game on Steam. Play it for the tunes. Play it because it's a challenge you'll be working to overcome for days, no matter your skills. Whether you're just trying to beat the game with all of your continues or get a new high score, there's always a reason to replay it. 

I'm a fairly new Touhou fan, but I'd totally recommend it anyways.

37677228.review:
首先恭喜东方正作登录steam！
然后是测评：
说实话，得知东（ce）方（wan）天（zhu）空（yuan）璋（zhang）登陆steam，我的第一反应是期待，第二反应就是“为什么偏偏只有这一作！”“为什么偏偏是这一作！”
毫无疑问，每次正作发布都是爱好者的一次狂欢。同样的，天空璋也是。大家都在期待神主能带给我们什么惊喜。然而，对于圈外的人却不是这样。
天空璋好玩吗？好玩！
天空璋适合引人入坑吗？恐怕不那么适合！
本作的季节系统很有趣，但无疑增加了操作的复杂程度。而且对于新人来说，分辨点数和弹幕已经很困难了，现在还要区分茫茫多的季节点，更加大了上手难度。即便是老手相信也被“包在雪球里的石头”-1up，更不要说新人了！
同样的，在时间节点上，不如红魔乡；难度难易上，角色、音乐群众基础上不如神灵庙、永夜抄；甚至系统上也不如绀珠传（对于新人）（没错我说的就是完美模式，个人觉得真的适合新人入坑）。这样的天空璋虽然是一款好游戏，但真的不适合推广。而东方上steam的主要目的是什么呢？捞钱？神主想捞不用这么复杂！那么只有向外推广了。所以说很遗憾，只有天空璋这一作在steam上售卖。
希望未来能有更多的东方作品登上steam。
同时，友情提示各位新人：当你对天空璋的某些设定感到不适时，不妨去试试东方其他作品，也许会给你打开一扇新的大门！

37641790.review:
1시간만에, 노말과 엑스트라를 빠르게 클리어하고 조심스럽게 글을 남깁니다. 
 



<東方天空璋 ～ Hidden Star in Four Seasons>



동방 정규작 16번째 시리즈, "동방천공장".

 한여름의 환상향에, 사계절이 전부 나타나는 이변을 둘러싸고 이야기는 시작됩니다.


 잔기, 봄신령을 위해 영계모드를 쓰고싶은 욕망을 억누른 채 애지중지 C키를 봉인해 두어야 하고, 그마저도 미스나면 강제발동됨으로서 클라운피스 횃불 본 것 마냥 사람을 개빡치게 만드는 신령묘와 달리 천공장에서는 C키를 언제 어디서나, 적극적으로 활용할 수 있게 되었습니다.

 또한 문화첩과 요정대전쟁 이후 정식 넘버링 작품에 플레이어 기체로 등장한 신문기자 아야와, 흑누나가 되어 돌아온 치르노, 스테이지마다 바뀌는 계절과 그에 어울리는 Bgm, 계절에 따라 새롭게 바뀐 봄(Bomb) 스프라이트는 천공장의 볼륨을 더해줍니다.

 그럼 우리 천공장에 대해서 알아봅시다. 기본적인 조작은 숙지하고 계실 거라 믿고...




1. C키의 부활 (계절해방 시스템)
 

 신령묘에서 영계모드로 등장했던 C키가, 계절해방 시스템으로 새롭게 부활. 이것은 천공장의 시작이자 끝이며 
이 계절해방을 어떻게, 적재적소에 맞게 사용하느냐에 따라서 잔기벌기와 스코어링, 크게는 클리어 난이도에 큰 영향을 미칩니다.

 일단 계절해방을 사용함으로서 적탄을 소거할 수 있으며, 봄(Bomb) 과는 달리 몇번을 사용한들 스펠카드 보너스에는 아무 영향을 주지 않습니다. 

 그리고 소거된 탄은 녹색 점템으로 바뀌는데 이것은 파랑 점템의 최대 득점을 올려주며 계절해방으로 얻는 초록 점템 외에는 어떤 방법으로도 파란 점템의 최대 득점량을 올릴 수 없습니다. 

 때에 따라서는 샷을 쏘지 않고 계절해방을 난사함으로서 득점을 뻥튀기한 후 보스의 피를 깎거나 자코를 빠르게 처리하는 등 활용도가 무궁무진합니다. 

 실력도 필요하지만 적절한 센스, 개인의 재량이 따르기에 이 천공장을 더욱 깊이있고 재미있게 하는 주 요소라고 할까요.

 +각 계절에 따른 계절해방 능력은 후술.




2. 익스텐드 시스템

  잔기 시스템이 풍신록 이후로 종적을 감추었던 '점수에 따른 추가 잔기' 를 얻는 방식으로 바뀌었기 때문에 원활한 클리어를 위해서는 필수적으로 스코어링을 할 필요가 있습니다.

 추가 잔기는 타 작품처럼 2개로 시작하며 스토리 모드에서는
500만-1000만-2000만-4000만-7000만-1억-1억5000만-2억2000만-5억-10억 단위로 익스텐드하며,
엑스트라 모드에서는 1000만-2000만-4000만-6000만-8000만-1억 단위로 익스텐드합니다.




3. 플레이어 기체

 하쿠레이 레이무, 치르노, 샤메이마루 아야, 키리사메 마리사가 등장합니다.

 
<하쿠레이 레이무>

 레이무는 전 시리즈 공통인 호밍형 기체로, 고속이든 저속이든 호밍탄이며, 딜 능력도 괜찮고 필드전도 무난합니다.

 봄은 역시나 몽상봉인이며 이 또한 데미지도 무난하다만 5면 보스나 엑스트라 중보스에서 레이무의 봄이 2명에게 나눠져서 호밍되기에 한번에 잡지 못할 수 있다는 단점이 있기에 반드시 봄을 써야한다면 계절해방으로 버티면서 어느정도 체력을 깎아놓고 봄을 치시는 게 낫습니다.


 <치르노>

 확산형 기체로 저속 시 확산의 범위가 조금 좁아집니다. 
필드전은 비교적 수월하지만 확산형 기체라 기본적으로 데미지가 떨어지고, 보스전에서 보스 딜링이 약하기 때문에 잘못하시면 2면 같은 곳에서 잘못하면 타임오버로 조질 수도 있습니다. 기본샷을 이용한 극딜이 필요한 부분.
 
 봄은 사용 위치에 고정되는 선풍기입니다. 이게 상당히 오래 지속되는데, 봄을 통한 계절해방 게이지를 채우기에 좋으나 보스에게 닿지 않으면 데미지를 입힐 수 없으니 어려운 패턴에 접근해서 사용하는 등의 활용을 해야 한다는 점. 



<샤메이마루 아야>

 고속때 저확산샷이 나가고 저속 시 화영총 스프라이트를 리메이크한 듯하게 보이는 적을 관통하는 붉은 샷을 발사합니다. 
 무난한 데미지와 본작 유일한 관통샷이지만 눈에 띄게 쓰임이 있는 것은 아닌지라 안습... 굳이 꼽자면 3면에서 음양옥 자코를 빠르게 처리하거나 4면에서 체력이 높은 자코 뒤에서 나오는 자코를 잡기 편하다는 것? 

 하지만 봄은 매우 강합니다. 일직선으로 나가는 붉은 바람샷을 발사하는데 거의 보스 스펠카드를 스킵하고도 남을 정도로 강합니다. 지속시간 또한 치르노 급으로 길다는 것이 장점입니다.

 단점이라면 일직선 봄이기 때문에 그럴일은 드물겠지만 보스가 봄 범위 밖으로 나가거나 맞추지 못하면 데미지를 줄 수 없다는 것입니다. 또한 필드전에서 소거할 수 있는 탄 범위가 좁기 때문에 사용이 꺼려질 수 있습니다.

 그나마 위안인 점은 고속이동 중 봄을 쓰면 자신이 고속으로 이동하던 방향으로 봄이 천천히 이동한다는 점.



<키리사메 마리사>

 마리사는 전작과 마찬가지로 역시 관통이 되지 않는 4갈래 레이저을 쏘며 고속 시 가운데 2개는 거의 일직선으로 고정, 바깥쪽 2개는 양 옆으로 좀 퍼집니다. 
 저속 시 4갈래의 레이저가 완전히 일직선으로 고정되며, 영야초 앨리스 샷만큼 좁아집니다. 
 당연한 소리겠지만 영야초 앨리스보다 훨씬 화력은 좋아요.
 
봄은 당연히 마스터 스파크. 마스터 스파크의 발사 방향을 좌우키를 통해 조절 할 수 있지만 봄 사용시 기체 속도가 매우 느려지고 샷을 쏠 수 없다는 단점이 있습니다. 






4. 계절해방 능력

 서브 계절에 따라 계절해방 능력이 바뀌며 종류로는 봄-여름-가을-겨울-토용이 있습니다.

 적을 빨리 쓰러뜨리거나, 그레이즈하거나, 적에게 데미지를 줄 시 각 계절 색깔을 띈 계절 아이템이 나오는데 이를 모아서 계절해방 게이지를 최대 6단계까지 채울 수 있습니다. 게이지를 모으면 기체 뒤에 서브샷이 생기는데 이 서브샷은 각 플레이어 캐릭터의 하위호환이라고 보시면 됩니다...만 데미지는 미미한 정도. 

주의하실 것이 계절해방은 무적상태가 되는 것이 아니라 그냥 주변 탄막을 소거하는 것이기 때문에 피탄 봄처럼 쓰거나 계절해방 지속시간 중 보스나 요정에게 박으면 그냥 터집니다. 주의 또 주의...

 게이지가 1 이상이면 C키를 눌러서 모든 게이지를 소모해 계절해방을 사용 할 수 있습니다.
계절해방시 원이 생기는데 그 부분에 닿은 탄은 초록 점템으로 바뀌고 적에게 데미지도 줍니다. 
많이 모아서 사용할수록 지속시간과 데미지, 범위도 약간 증가하는 효과를 볼 수 있습니다.

<봄>

기체중심 범위로 발동됩니다. 지속시간이 짧으나 발동 범위가 넓습니다. 6게이지 모으고 쓰면 쾌감이..어우
근데 봄은 거의 안써봐서 뭐라 할 말이 없네요... 오키나 막스펠 마지막 체력 한 줄 패턴이 갑자기 존시나게 어려워 진다는 것 정도?


<여름>
 지속시간이 짧으나 계절해방을 할 경우 게이지가 1밖에 줄어들지 않습니다. 짧은 지속시간에 비해 데미지가 약한편도 아니고 어느때나 부담없이 쓸 수 있어서 스코어링, 클리어에도 자주 애용되는 계절입니다. 
 특히 내구가 단단한 요정을 잡기에도 좋고, 특히 6면 필드전을 먹튀할 수 있다는 것이 큰 장점입니다.

 단점은 계절해방을 사용하고 나서 잠깐동안 쓰지 못하는 시간이 있는데 그것때문에 계절해방이 사라지고 나서 바로 계절해방을 쓰지 못해 피탄당하는 경우가 있을 수 있습니다. 
오키나 막스펠 난이도는 중상 정도라고 생각됩니다. 솔직히 탄막은 자기가 직접 해봐야 아는지라...

<가을>
 계절해방 시 이동속도가 증가하고 계절해방 효과가 주위에 지속됩니다. 굳이 보스 앞에서 때려박지 않아도 이속 증가와 주위에 지속된다는 특성 덕분에 보스 앞까지 가서 데미지를 줄 수 있습니다. 오키나 막스펠 난이도는 제가 생각하기엔 여름보다 쉽다고 생각됩니다. 오키나가 아야마냥 빠르게 좌우로 왔다갔다 하긴 하지만 주 탄막인 화살탄의 판정이 후하고 패턴이 매우 단순하기 때문에.


<겨울>
 범위가 좁지만 지속시간 동안 샷의 파워가 강해진다는 장점이 있습니다. 데미지도 좋고 샷 데미지도 증가하기에 빠르게 패턴을 넘기고 싶을 때 쓴다고들 하는데 오키나 막스펠 난이도가 어렵게 느껴집니다. 물방울탄을 방사형으로 존내 쏴대는데 패턴자체가 기합회피라...

<토용>
 엑스트라 스토리에 맞춘 고정 계절입니다. 샷은 특이하게 캐릭터의 후방으로 나가고 계절해방 시 그 자리에 지속되는 것이 아니라 사용 자리에서 밑으로 내려가며 점점 작아집니다. 엑스트라 패턴 중 이 후방샷을 이용해서 오키나를 때려야 하는 패턴이 2번 정도 있습니다.

 뒤로 쏴서 맞출 일이 별로 없기에 후방샷의 위력이 매우 강하고 레이무의 호밍과 같이 쏜다면 더욱 강해집니다. 해방 데미지와 지속력 또한 좋아서 중보스 스펠 때 머리 위에서 약간의 차이를 두고 2번 써주면 바로 스펠을 격파 가능합니다. 오키나 통상 탄막 때 머리 위에서 한번 쏴주고 빠르게 밑으로 내려와서 때리거나 또한 필드전 패턴도 어느정도 이 계절해방으로만 커버가 가능합니다.
 엑스트라를 위해서 만들어진 티가 팍팍 나는 계절.



이 외에도 재미난 것들이 많지만 말보단 행동. 남이 플레이 하는 것과 설명만 읽는 것보단 직접 하면서 익히는 것이 탄막게임의 묘미라 생각합니다. 

또한 앞으로도 동방빙의화에 이어 전작들도 스팀에 릴리즈될 가능성이 있다고 합니다!

쭉 스팀에 나오길 기다려왔던 동방프로젝트. 앞으로의 스팀 플랫폼에 있어 장래가 기대되는 동방프로젝트. 

이참에 한번 구매하셔서 플레이 해보는 건 어떠신지?


참고가 되었길 바라며 저는 이만 여기서 줄이겠습니다.




Ps. 엑스트라 패턴화 진짜  쉽습니다. 일개 노말슈터가 1트만에 클리어한 거 보면 역대급인듯..

如果是新人玩家请不要被本作过高的好评率蒙骗，客观来说只有车万厨会购买本作，自然不会给差评。

本作继承以往优秀的音乐和符卡设计不会让您失望。

但现阶段仍有一些BUG没有修复，季节点数的掉落外形设计确实影响到了全局弹幕走向的判断（眼瞎）。

而对于ZUN大家都懂，他才不管有多少人买，有钱买啤酒就够了。修BUG？不存在的。

如果是对东方文化感兴趣而来尝试原作，请移步东方吧先玩了之前的作品喜欢上再买也不迟。

如果是对于STG类型游戏感兴趣，也可以尝试诸如彩京，Treasure，CAVE等系列作品，找到对口自己风格的STG。

东方文化因同人起家，也因同人大放异彩，喜欢东方文化却又弹幕苦手的诸位真的没必要强制自己买下，这真不是什么厨力的证明，更不是什么买了就值得炫耀的东西，请正确认识东方在同人的地位和系列作品在STG圈的地位

【兼容steam版的汉化补丁已放出，感谢喵玉汉化！】

身为一个刚入坑两年的萌新，很早就想玩一玩官方正作，可惜一直没有机会。如今東方终于登入steam平台，这真的是令我欣喜若狂，我终于可以亲身体验一下東方游戏啦！
不玩不知道，一玩吓一跳！没想到東方游戏是这么的好玩，华丽壮观的弹幕，还有优美动听的音乐，这俩结合起来简直无法用言语来形容我当时的感受！
情感摩天楼，小人族以及其他诸多東方音乐，每当我听到这些旋律时，我的眼泪都不禁地流了下来，每一次都能震撼我的人心！这也许就是東方魅力的所在吧。
与其说我爱東方，倒不如说東方已经成为我生命中不可缺少的一部分了，也许每一位東方爱好者都是这样的吧。有些人可能会觉得我很ZZ，但这确实是我所想表达的感情。许多年以后，我对東方的观念可能会有所转变，但是，我绝不会忘记它给我带来的那些美好的回忆！
東方始终在我的心中，没有任何东西可以撼动它在我心中的地位，愿東方永远辉煌！
最后的最后，此生无悔入東方，来世炸了幻想乡！233333

37542992.review:
I've played this game before it went on steam, but there's very little faults with it aside from some bugs. Compared to other Touhou games (specifically the previous installment, Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom), this game might be perceived as being easy, but it really isn't, not if you aren't used to the difficulty and can learn the patterns quickly.

The music is pretty good, some might say that it's not his best work, but I think it has some really good tracks, namely Hidden Star in All Seasons, Concealed Four Seasons, Illusionary White Traveler, A Pair of Divine Beasts, but the others are pretty fine too.

As with any touhou game, the characters have plenty of personality and more of which can be derived from their origins in folklore, myth and such. I'd say it's definitely worth checking out if you like "simpler" more arcade-ish games, like bullet hells.

ZUN是站着喝啤酒而戴帽子的唯一的人。他身材很高大；青白色，皱纹间时常夹些伤痕；一头乱蓬蓬的散乱的头发。穿的虽然是白衬衫，可是又脏又破，似乎十多年没有补，也没有洗。他对人说话，总是满口NMNB随便扭扭，叫人半懂不懂的。因为他喝酒，别人便从描红纸上的“啤酒爱好者”这半懂不懂的话里，替他取下一个绰号，叫作啤酒星人。神主一到店，所有喝酒的人便都看
着他笑，有的叫道，“ZUN，你脸上又添上新伤疤了！”他不回答，对柜里说，“温两碗酒，要一碟永仪酒。”便排出⑨文大钱
。他们又故意的高声嚷道，“你一定又撞了sabi五面交叉弹！”神主睁大眼睛说，“你怎么这样凭空污人清白……”“什么清白？我前天亲眼见你乱扭五面双boss，吊着打。”神主便涨红了脸，额上的青筋条条绽出，争辩道，“交叉弹不能算sabi……交叉……萌新的事，能算sabi么？”接连便是难懂的话，什么“萌新挑战”，什么“NB”之类，引得众人都哄笑起来：店内外充满了快活的空气。

37316275.review:
好时代，来临吧！

严格意义上说，这并非正作首次网络化，但相较于仅在日本本地站点上贩售的辉针城，天空璋在蒸汽上的登录无论是正规性还是国际性都有了质的不同

对于本作本身的评价，据人概括：[strike]一流设定，二流制作，三流音乐[/strike]。以下会在此基础之上添加一些个人看法：
设定方面，[strike]zun在时隔多年之后，终于……[/strike]对幻想乡本身进行了一次大规模的底层更新，可喜可贺可喜可贺；
制作方面，本作混关比较容易（[strike]相比之下即使yyc也有时符这一道坎，而yym在easy下看不到完整剧情[/strike]），再辅以对全符卡单独练习的支持，对新人可以说相当友好了，但也有玩家表示本作的季节点干扰画面对走位判断产生了不利影响，且许多bug至今没能得到有效解决（[strike]ggz还更了b版呢[/strike]）
音乐方面，评价似乎普遍不怎么好（相对其他整数作而言），部分人反映一些道中曲有明显模仿前作的痕迹，但就个人实际体验而言，不管怎么说相比hzc多数曲子还是有其明显的主基调的（[strike]至少不需要耳机来分辨，还请hzc厨不要打我[/strike]），5/6/ex面boss曲也非常好听

总的来说，本作颇有几分毁誉参半的味道，但有东方这块招牌，尽管略显平庸，仍有一玩的价值，中文的话指南有汉化发布了所以不用担心，如果说还有什么提示的话……
[spoiler][strike]Tips：不用季节上梦冬，用季节上文秋，多学习他人的replay，以及，新手不想续关的话，请从及时放bomb开始（笑）[/strike][/spoiler]

最后，依zun“官作上架=同人解禁”的惯例，展望未来，也恭祝拥有悠久传统的东方同人游戏能进入一个新的时代
[spoiler]另外……稍微塞点私货，若有人有一定音乐制作水平的话，请一定要想办法跟东方年代记制作组联系并帮忙。作为一款东方同人rpg，本作不论故事性还是游戏性都达到了极高的水准，但因制作组缺乏作曲人才，多数bgm均挪用自其他著作者的制品，以致版权问题成为了海外推广的一大障碍，如今乘着这股新风，还愿优秀的作品能传播到更远的地方，拜托各位了[/spoiler]

steamに過去の名作stgや優れた同人stgがリリースされている中で遂に東方が来たって感じですね
ノーマルモードの難易度は程よい難易度でstg初心者でもクリアのチャンスがあると思います。今作ではボムの他にも季節開放というシステムがあり、季節開放することによって一定時間無敵になり周りの弾幕を消すなどの効果があります。ボムと季節開放を惜しみなく使うことによってクリアはグッと近くなります。
不満点としては季節アイテムによって弾幕が見づらくなるということです。また最近の東方作品でよく見かける発光弾が今作にもあり視認性が悪いものとなっています。こういう視認性の悪さで難易度を上げるのは個人的に好きではないのでやめて欲しいところ。

37237903.review:
Touhou was my first bullet hell, and I'm so damn happy to finally have a way to give ZUN money (that doesn't involve jumping through a ludicrous number of hoops).

Compared to the non-Touhou shmups I have, I'd say it's a slower paced style of game. If you find other bullet hells too fast I'd say Touhou games are a good starting point; you'll need to plan ahead a little to score well, and learning to do it in Touhou carries over well to other games.
Compared to other Touhou games? My first was PCB and this gives me a lot of the same vibes, but it doesn't have quite the same level of visual spectacle (admittedly I'm mostly thinking of the final bosses). It's a good middle ground difficulty-wise, and the mechanics are fairly easy to understand for scoring. I do find the spellcards a bit...lacking visually (they don't really match their themes if that makes sense) but it feels like there's a bit more variety within the game in terms of ...play style? (words are hard)

That said so far I find this one's a bit messier visually even with the English patch's transparency fix, and the backgrounds are a little busy in places so it can be disorienting at times. It also stretches really weirdly on the highest resolution setting, and I'd recommend picking the middle one instead (the patched menu is especially unreadable stretched for some reason).

At the end of the day though this whole review is horribly biased because I love Touhou. If you didn't like other Touhou games this one will not change your mind.

37143772.review:
ついにsteamに来た東方project。
その第一弾である本作は新展開への序章でありまた難易度も比較的易しめとなっています。
特に今回採用された季節開放システムとスコアエクステンドの組み合わせは、残機というわかりやすいリソース増加からパターン組み立てのモチベーションになりやすく、またリソースの豊富さのお陰で危ない時に躊躇なくボムを切れたりクリアに向かって詰める時にミスをある程度許容して平静を保ちやすいです。

欠点としては背景と弾、季節アイテムから来る視認性の悪さです。
背景と弾は双方が同系色になる2面4面辺りが要注意。
個人的には季節アイテムと弾はそこまで大きな問題ではありませんでしたが、ある程度季節開放に慣れてくるとボスが吐き出す大量の季節アイテムでボスが見えづらくなるため接近しようとして接触するケースが気になりました。
また今後バージョンアップで直る可能性もありますがスペルプラクティスの5面ボス周りにバグが多いです。

ゲーム性以外の感覚的な所では音楽とステージ演出のマッチングが素晴らしく、特に4面道中と6面ボスが印象に残りました。
キャラクターも昔から幻想郷にいたような気がします。この辺りは好みですが。

結論としてはおすすめです。特に東方projectを体験したい方は是非！

37110425.review:
在给不给推荐上想了很久，结果还是给了推荐。并不是说这一作多么多么棒，只是因为它是东方。

作为第一款登陆了steam的作品，就算做的再不好，也要给与支持，当然本作也不差就是了，只是相比于前几作，没那么出彩罢了。

优点：
季节的设定很有趣，不同人物搭配不同的季节可以玩出很多花样，适应面广，同时也可以补足各个人物的不足，比如火力强度或者覆盖面积啥的。

然后，季节解放(C)很好用，在很多时候C都可以救命的。而且攒的也快，在弹幕密集的地方可以达到收支平衡，即交出C后可以立刻在集满C，尤其是夏的C。更重要的一点是不会影响击破符卡的额外评分，这个很重要233。

难度上，本作整体难度个人认为在历代中可以划分到中上。但是E很容易，非常容易，很亲民，很适合新手或者对于STG苦手的玩家。当然了，这就导致E到N的难度跨度略大，可能会让第一次接触到的玩家难以接受。只能说，多虐虐就好了233。

缺点：
弹幕，背景以及季节强化道具的颜色经常会让人眼花，使眼睛快速疲劳而导致Miss或者疮痍（比如第二面道中配春，或者二面Boss第一张副卡配冬）。尤其是季节道具，本身就多，如果颜色再与弹幕重合的话，是非常致命的。希望以后能有补丁改进吧，比如在设定里加入一个 显示/隐藏 选项，又或者透明度设置。

其次，EX面boss与6面boss是同一人啥的。。。虽然是剧情设定[spoiler]这真的不是偷懒嘛？[/spoiler]，多多少少还是会让人有些不满的吧。。。还是希望ex面boss是新人物比较好。毕竟辛辛苦苦打到ex面，结果发现boss还是老人物。。。[spoiler]绝望[/spoiler]

还有[spoiler]TND[/spoiler]成就系统和卡片系统去哪了？？为什么这些最基本的东西都没有？？？EXM？？？这就好比PS没有奖杯，蓝瘦香菇。强烈希望以后加入。

其他：
音乐方面还是一如既往，ZUN的曲子没得黑。唯独一点，说好的自古三面出神曲呢？？？个人比较喜欢的是第五面boss曲和ex面boss曲，真心好顶赞。

立绘方面嘛。。。本身就没期待过，随便怎么样都好2333。

价格方面，看到评论区有人说50块比较贵。。。我只能说，你没看到美国这边的价格，15刀。。。当然15刀也不贵就是了，本来预期是20刀的。

至于网上流传的各种bug，我是一个都没有遇见过，具体不评论。

最后，新人如果想要入坑的话，不是很推荐这一作，个人比较推荐的是th8永夜抄。希望以后其他的东方作品也会登陆steam。

37046582.review:
Ну вот вышла новая Тохо игра в стиме. Я мечтал об этом в 2012-2013 годах, когда стим еще не подавал признаки падения вниз головой (платные моды, подтасовка рецензий). Спустя годы Тохо вышла, можно купить за 360 рублей, чтобы не качать вишню с торрентов и брат остался жив. Однако сколько уже пилятся эти игры? Почти 20 лет. А всё так же 60 фпс лок, разрешение 1280х720 и нечеткие иконки подбираемых предметов. Я понимаю такие ограничения для EoSD, я понимаю пиксельный стиль рисования в первых файтингах, но уже прошло столько лет, а япошки всё гонят однообразный шлак как сговорились: фпс лок в 30/60 кадров на Dark Souls 1, играх Square Enix. Ганьба. Уже пора перейти минимум на 120 фпс лок, принимая, что такие игры нуждаются в привязке кадров к физике объектов.


Новые персонажи не запоминаются, я их не признаю. Вообще после 12.5 (Double Spoiler) не играл — не понимаю одноразовых героев. Этот тайтл пойдёт как украшение профиля, как метод считать потраченные часы в Тохо. А вот упороться игрой как раньше? Не думаю.


Тохо для меня — источник эйфории и мои любиые игры это фото-игры за Аю Сямеймару 9.5 и 12.5.

37005771.review:
一时没有关注都上架这么久了，赶快入一下补个票。

作为世界上同人创作最多的弹幕游戏，东方的元素或者说meme已经渗透在很多文化领域，虽然参与者未必有所觉察。巨量的同人图片(截止2017年八月P站2.03m张)，大量的同人音乐（1.4TB神种v.18）大量的视频创作(bad apple合集av11012106)，无数有爱的创作者们......什么让东方如此受欢迎？有人觉得游戏是本体，有人觉得音乐是重点，有人觉得独特的角色风格吸引人创作。

七年来和东方若即若离，可以说是入坑不易，第一次接触是偶然用了蕾米做头像，被人说到是东方的才搜了一下。后来从高人气角色灵梦魔理沙爱丽丝开始慢慢了解，到红魔馆，西行寺，永远亭，风神录，地灵殿...再后来玩了前几个新作，虽然手残只过了简单，但是这过程中喜欢上了很多东方音乐和zun绘（画风仔细看还是萌萌哒），入了本子看了同人小说和文花帖，也算上年轻的车万众了，只差去一次博丽灵梦例大祭现场。

与东方的故事听起来简单是因为我是单独了解并慢慢爱上它的，一些有前辈带着或者和朋友一起入坑的可能更顺利一些更快一些吧。但是现在的一些所谓东方众除了念诗两句外还喜欢认为只有自己知道的才是对的，为一设二设谁强谁弱撕个不停，对别人的介绍视频频挑刺恶言相向（心疼二次元囧星人，那么喜欢东方最后被ta的观众劝退了），对新人毫无耐心一副不好的态度，或者与此相反疯狂安利，四处念诗......希望能有更好一点的环境吧。

至于这款的话我还没有玩过，趁着zun把它上架steam也刚好试试，玩过再测评。可惜没有出steam卡牌，不然合个东方背景放个人资料里还不是美滋滋，价格应该不会太夸张，毕竟隔壁月球人都没太太高fate的。另外东方的汉化果然不用担心，自有大佬用爱肝出，喊6就行。 https://pan.baidu.com/s/1c2fJn5Q
按以往来看，射击苦手可以选择玩esay难度，只要稍微练习几次，不要省B，剧情还是可以轻松通过的。NMNB疯狂擦弹什么的让大角虫去做吧。

希望th16東方天空璋销量更好些吧，让zun把其他作品放到steam来，也让更多人了解东方文化。

为幻想乡的未来献上祝福。

背板？不存在的。
随便扭扭，一B带走。
帕秋莉♂GO

36961105.review:
Most people who are here on a game with japanese title and full japanese description probability already know what Touhou is so for those whom are aware you can just skip the review.

For those who aren't aware it is a japanese indie game which is difficult to get outside of japan, there are 15 games before this. Be aware it is a bullet hell game which is not suitable for everyone's interest.

Before carrying on it is improtant to note that there is an english patch avaliable for free in the community hub.

There are 6 stages with 4 difficulity and 4 characters and 4 sub shot to choose from. It is possible to avoid all attacks without bombing (with the exception of the one attack from stage 6) as a result there is no restricted resource management system. Upon clearing the game without contiuning on normal an extra stage is unlocked which is a 11 minute maratorn stage.

The soundtrack are pleasant to listen to with one for every stage and one for every boss. The only issue i have with the game is it's FPS drop from 60 to 20, this can also be fixed by following instructions in the community hub.
Highly recommended for those intrested in trying out the bullet hell genre or are fans of touhou fan medium.

如果一定要在推荐或不推荐里选一个的话，还是更偏向不推荐。
bug什么的先不管，单从游戏性看，可玩性极差。混关十分简单而且相当无聊，弹幕强度还算合理但是判定巨大，习惯了妖永判定又喜欢作死高速盲控的几乎一飞一个撞。分数系统也让人没有深入研究的欲望，开C贴脸消弹既涨蓝点分又擦出分数点，停枪CCCCCC就是了。屏幕很花，很乱，有时候弹幕密了开C下来甚至可能一眼找不到自机。
如果对系列有兴趣，还是推荐从th07-th10选一作开打。

36911419.review:
The ZUN has landed.

Quick review but I've been playing Touhou STGs for years and I kind of lost track of the series after the disappointment I had with Ten Desires. By the looks and comments, neither Touhou 14-15 were that memorable either and, considering the series is so far in its number of entries, that Touhou 16 managed to have both good music and rather decent mechanics make it a nice entrance for ZUN into Steam territory.

The thing is that due to the lack of localization you may be on your own trying to determine what each of the characters, options and hitboxes do. A voyage of discovery I may say. On the bright side, we know how this rolls, psycho miko and her buddies investigate an incident, meet some girl who is out of her mind, beat her up violently and with extreme prejudice and, eventually, it all devolves into a warm tea party with cookies.

A very colorful, danmaku filled tea party. The spell cards are creative, some are gimmicky, some are challenging, I feel there is something for everyone but the micro-dodging and precision, as well as the quest for safespots and graze milking points and such things may drive a lot of people crazy. Crimzon Clover this is not! Still, recommended.

36873663.review:
Nunca creí que viviría lo suficiente para ver un juego oficial de Touhou Project en Steam!

Que les puedo decir que no se haya dicho antes, es un excelente juego shoot’em up vertical de tipo bullet hell con una magnifica banda sonora y buen diseño de personajes.

Su dificultad es alta (como cualquier juego de este género), pero, no tan enfermiza como lo fue el juego anterior (TH15: LoLK) a lo que lo hace disfrutable.
Cuenta con 4 personajes jugables con 4 diferentes tipos de disparo por lo que no hay que preocuparse por falta de rejugabilidad.

Lo que muchos le ven de malo es que no cuenta con logro, cromos ni scoreboards, pero la verdad, eso no debería de contar ya que es el primer juego de la saga que llega a esta plataforma y de forma muy inesperada por lo que eso ya debería de empezar a contar para los futuros juegos de Touhou que lleguen a Steam.

También se menciona lo del idioma, que no viene traducido al inglés. Nunca han tenido traducciones oficiales a otros idiomas, pero la comunidad ha hecho un buen trabajo creando un parche muy útil que te traduce el juego a cualquier idioma que este en su base de datos.

Recomendadisimo si eres fan del género y te gustan los desafíos.

Que siga generando ventas para que su creador (ZUN) saque más joyas de esta saga en esta asombrosa plataforma ~

10/10

36819003.review:
This is the first time this game's creator, ZUN, has had a way to send any game in the Touhou franchise out to a western audience, and obviously the ones that have been paying some attention has been drinking it up like ZUN drinks his beer. Touhou is one of those game series that defies even western otaku presence and made it's way into the minds of people that know only Nintendo at best. HOWEVER, I DO NOT recommend Hidden Star in Four Seasons to be your first foray into the STG genre. Touhou has games that are more simple and less challenging, namely Perfect Cherry Blossom, that you should defeat and use to get used to the genre's obsession of filling your screen with a maze of projectiles and this game's controls before you head back and pick up this one. Have you? Great! Then pick up this game.

This game specifically has a "mini-bomb" game mechanic, where getting close to bullets spawns collectables that fill a meter that, if full, you can use to destroy bullets. There's four flavors for it, each with different effects. It's mostly non-broken, the fall variant being the only one that can really break the game, and even then you need high execution to do so. Either way, ZUN has made the stages harder to counter the fact that flashbombs exist, so if you don't have any experience in the genre, prepare to get wrecked. There's easier games in the franchise, even with this game mechanic in mind.

Lore and characters are generally not required to be enjoyed about these games, but I'll have you know that the stage one boss, Eternity Larva, is the cutest fairy in the entire series. Even cuter than Cirno. Fight me.

This is, of course, a "shmup" game, which means you'll be flying past a million bullets and clearing them with a "bomb" super-attack when you feel stuck. It's all about precision and action, and those who prefer a less precision-based game might wanna go play other games, but those who love precise-movement games like I Wanna Be The Guy might find themselves at home.

Overall, this isn't the best shmup to get into if you're brand new, seek other resources to download earlier entries for that (until they pop up on steam, of course, then buy them), but those who are accustomed thanks to the likes of Rabi-Ribi, Cuphead, and I Wanna Be The Guy, will find themselves right at home.
Also, support ZUN. He needs his beer after us needing to pirate his games for the longest time.

36818710.review:
Esta análise foi postada inicialmente em uma página do Facebook, a [i]Fui jogar Touhou no lunatic, mas esqueci que sou míope[/i], por mim, em agosto deste ano no lançamento na Comiket 92. Como o jogo continua idêntico, não vejo problema dar um copiar e colar no mesmo texto.

[h1]TL;DR: Jogo bom e bem simples. Só não perca muito tempo se dedicando a ele.[/h1]

[b]Touhou Tenkuushou (Eastern Sky Jade Scepter) ~ Hidden Star in Four Seasons[/b] é o 16º título da série principal, lançado nesta Comiket 92 dia 11 de agosto de 2017. Nosso amado ZUN dessa vez decidiu fazer um jogo com mecânicas bem tradicionais de shoot'em up, sem muita inovação na gameplay — eu sei, DDC tentou fazer isso também [strike]embora o LoLK, o Touhou 15, tenha voltado atrás com isso e trazido uma história complexa, mas já chego lá[/strike], mas desta vez ele foi além. Devido a isso, sistemas como o de coletar vidas extras voltam a ser como nas primeiras fases da franquia, neste caso coletar um número X de pontos. Devo dizer que todo esse sistema ficou muito bem implementado, o jogo está muito bem feito e polido. Embora tenha um pequeno probleminha: [i]Touhou 16 não está tão difícil quanto os seus anteriores[/i]. Não vejo lá como um problema, e o jogo ainda assim está bem desafiador, mas pode incomodar alguns.

A história se passa no meio do verão, quando de repente vários locais diferentes de Gensokyo começam a manifestar diferentes estações: o santuário Hakurei com um monte de pétalas de cerejeira, a montanha youkai parecendo que está no outono, a floresta da mágica cheia de neve, e por aí vai, também com relatos das estações mudarem de um dia pro outro em cada local. Reimu, Marisa e Aya percebem isto, e então partem para investigar o incidente. Cirno aparece depois, com seu novo bronzeado por causa do verão, querendo dominar tudo e se mostrar [i]a melhor[/i] — como sempre.
Admito que fiquei um pouco decepcionado com o enredo desta vez; LoLK teve uma história tão boa e detalhada que eu achei que seguiriam a mesma linha de complexidade e conexão com outros elementos da lore. Claro, tem a final boss que [spoiler]é uma das fundadoras de Gensokyo e suas ações talvez tenham sido a causa dos acontecimentos de Touhou 14.5[/spoiler], mas mesmo assim foi bem pouco. Talvez tenha uma ligação mais forte com o Touhou 15.5, assim como o LoLK teve uma forte ligação com o ULiL. Mas vamos ter que esperar pra ver.

Como viram na história, as protagonistas desta vez são Reimu, Marisa, Aya e Cirno. Como falei na minha análise prévia da trial lançada em maio deste ano (lá na página), Reimu tem seus homing shots, Marisa tem seus piercing lasers, Aya e seus spread shots, e Cirno com seus shotgun bullets. Cada personagem tem seus tiros principais e bombas (nada de novo pra Reimu e pra Marisa, já Cirno tem uma bomba parecida com a da Yukari no IN e a da Aya tem uma parecida com uma das da Sanae no UFO), mas na tela de seleção de personagem, aparece uma opção para escolher o tiro secundário + habilidade especial, onde essa habilidade especial era carregada com vários níveis disponíveis a partir de itens que dropavam de inimigos, balas apagadas ou puro graze mesmo. Escolhendo o tiro [i]primavera[/i], você ganha homing shots adicionais e a habilidade especial é uma esfera que apaga balas e dá dano cujo tamanho aumenta a cada nível que tu aumenta; escolhendo o tiro [i]verão[/i], você ganha shotgun bullets adicionais e a habilidade especial é uma esfera que faz o mesmo que a anterior, apenas que essa tem um tamanho único e os níveis são unidades de quantas esferas tu pode usar; escolhendo o tiro [i]outono[/i], você ganha spread shots adicionais e a habilidade especial é uma esfera que envolve a sua personagem e permitirá o jogador se movimentar livre pois ela destruirá as balas e acertará inimigos, porém ela tem duração limitada, e ela é estendida com seu nível; escolhendo o tipo [i]inverno[/i], você ganha piercing lasers adicionais e a habilidade especial é uma esfera pequena que age como escudo, e quanto maior o nível, maior duração ela possui.

Na época do trial eu achava que essas mecânicas seriam desse jeito, simples e diretas, e a única coisa que eu teria que fazer é ter habilidade para vencer. No final, foi assim até chegar na última boss, onde eu tive que bolar uma boa estratégia e usar bem a habilidade especial para derrota-la. [i]E de uma forma bem criativa![/i] Gostei muito disso. No modo Extra é melhor ainda, tu recebe um tiro secundário único para ele e a fase inteira é um desafio que só depende do quão bem tu consegue se virar com ele. Deu uma ótima sensação de vitória ao finalizar o modo, pois eu morria, usava bomba e logo depois eu descobria uma forma melhor de passar. Valeu muito a pena. [spoiler]Dark Souls be like kek[/spoiler]

Bem, agora é hora de falar das coisas que eu tenho para criticar. Eu posso ter gostado muito de Touhou 16, principalmente por causa da gameplay, mas tenho várias coisas pra citar a respeito dele que me incomodaram. Começando pelas bosses, onde apenas duas são personagens bem criativas e interessantes. Assim como a história, fiquei muito decepcionado com as fases finais, deu demais a sensação de que o ZUN ficou sem nenhum pingo de criatividade ao faze-las. Posso resumir toda essa crítica em um único termo: [b]falta de criatividade.[/b] Sendo ela mais presente na reta final do jogo em relação à história, às personagens, às fases, céus... [i]até a música sofreu um tanto![/i] São áreas bonitas e bem feitas, claro, e a trilha sonora ainda tem o charme de Touhou, são muito boas, porém parecem que foram altamente inspiradas em um título ou outro da franquia e apenas inseridas ali. Foi um declínio nestes quesitos se comparado ao LoLK e até a outros jogos anteriores.

[b]Conclusão:[/b] Touhou 16 HSiFS é um excelente título, muito divertido e bastante polido, com sistemas simples mas que tiveram um uso muito bem feito, e pra mim o segundo melhor Extra já feito no quesito gameplay, perdendo apenas pro do Touhou 7. Todavia, possui um dos pontos fracos que mais incomodam na franquia, que é a falta de criatividade no jogo em geral, nos spellcards, nas fases, nas personagens, em elementos das músicas, e na história. Diferente do Touhou 15 LoLK, este não é um título para se levar a sério e se dedicar, e sim [i]para tu pegar, jogar e pronto.[/i] Talvez eu esteja sendo meio chato criticando esse detalhe pois era exatamente o que ZUN pretendia, como falei nas primeiras frases desta análise, e eu torço para que este tenha sido apenas um experimento e que ele melhore bastante no próximo título. Mas o que fez todos nós amarmos Touhou foi como a franquia tem personagens e elementos artísticos criativos. E espero que com Touhou 15.5, que virá para Steam ano que vem, não decepcione nisso.

36692698.review:
有名同人弾幕シューティングゲーム第16弾。
同ジャンルの中では弾速が遅く密度の高い花火のような弾幕が特徴のシリーズ。
良くも悪くも本質的に10年以上変わらない。全部一人で作っているのでイラストはご愛嬌。

[h1]良い点[/h1]
[list]
    [*]音楽が独特で高品質。
    [*]各難易度のレベルデザインがしっかりしている。
    [*]ボス戦練習モードが充実
    [*]自機4種と4色の季節サブ装備が自由に選べて色々な装備が楽しめる。
[/list]

[h1]悪い点[/h1]
[list]
    [*]4色の季節アイテムと敵のカラフルな弾幕が混ざって事故死が多い。
    [*]2017年のゲームとしては仕様が古い。
[/list]

[h1]仕様[/h1]
[list]
    [*]解像度は最大で1280x960。
    [*]色設定も互換モードで動かす必要がある。
    [*]コントローラー入力がXInput非対応。箱○コンではアナログスティックで移動になる。(Bigpictureモードでキー割り当て可能）
[/list]

デモ版もあるので試してみてあうようならどうぞ。変な帽子はそのうち慣れます。

[h1]補足[/h1]
XBox360コントローラーの十字キーを使用したい場合はSteamのBigpictureモードを使用し、コントローラーのプロファイルを割り当てると自由にキーが割り振れます。また、すでに作成済みのプロファイルが複数公開されています。

36692407.review:
上架之后，在第二时间入手了正版。
之所以没有马上购买，是因为习惯性地想要等打折再入。果然，steam的打折是坏文明！
不过，因为实在是太想玩，所以还是在第二天剁了手。

作为一个东方整数作E难度党，很高兴的是近年来，ZUN将E难度设计的不是那么困难。对于我这种想要看到异变的黑幕的手残来说，是一个，大，好，事，儿。
本作《东方天空璋》也不例外，这次的E难度非常亲民。想要了解异变的黑幕，打通E难度就可以了。对于想要了解东方最新的剧情和人物，本作可以说是一个可以非常直观的渠道。毕竟，以前的作品，想要通关并了解到剧情不是这么简单——th6红魔乡E难度是无法见到大小姐的；th7妖妖梦就算是E难度，幽幽子的墨染樱也是许多人的噩梦；th8永夜抄熬过辉夜的时符简直就是一个折磨。

好在，这一次，天空璋的E难度下，六面秘神的符卡都没有什么反人类的设计。我是指，什么高速自机狙啊，曲线激光阵啊，多重变速弹啊，封路弹幕啊……都没有！
不会出现买了游戏，结果打不过，只能放游戏库里证明自己为情怀买过单的尴尬窘境。

目前，我已经E难度通了灵梦、文文、魔理沙，⑨还没确定用什么季节，暂时还没通。其中，灵梦第二遍通关选的副季节冬，已达成No Miss，且符卡全收集。我自己都吓一跳——至少一年没碰STG了，居然能做到这个水平，其中的成就感是无可比拟的。

如果还有在观望的“过气车万”厨，不要犹豫，买买买！

36690445.review:
我告诉自己，这是真的，这不是梦。
万不曾想到，有朝一日我能入正东方。
希望zun能把其他作也补上steam。QWQ。虽然有信仰，奈何吃土少年用不起代购摸不起实体盘。

回过来说天空璋。（目前只玩了N难度和Ex面，因为被绀珠传吓到，甚至我其实是想e难度起手的）
对我这个万年N难度的咸鱼来说。。
天空璋相对来说挺容易。起手难度N，在初见的情况下还是4残的通关了，并且直接回收了大量的符卡
主要的一点就是作为天空璋新系统的“季节力量”（C键）
释放层数，获得一个短暂buff和橡皮擦子，并且立刻回收台面上所有点数

和妖妖梦里的樱结界相仿，然而可控，开与不开都取决自己。并且释放季节并不算在炸b乃至中弹，符卡仍然可以回收
和神灵庙的灵界有点相仿，然而相对量产，不用烦恼于规划，纠结到底何时再打开收益更大。
熟练了使用的话，恐怕天空璋是目前最容易NH，NB，NHNB的一作了

普通关卡的弹幕考底力为主，多是姿势弹，拼的是熟练，运气成分就没有那么浓重了，所以不用担心各种奇怪的玄学坠落，值得一提的是秘神的终符，这次的终符是直接火力剥夺。强制使用0火力战斗。

然而到了ex面....我在ex关卡里感受到了恶意....东方爆菊璋！
一开始我不知道为什么僚机只有那个ass弹。。。
直到我下面..........
到了ex面，你可能会开始犹豫使用季节力量的时机了，在ex面自下而上的场合很多。。甚至秘神自己也会跑下面去。让你不得不用ass弹怼之，因为僚机的火力取季节层数，如果使用过多。可能会导致某些场合火力不足而咸鱼。。

当然，还值得一提的一点。zun也是有希望我们能试着去学习规划一类的，不要一昧吝惜手头资源，当用则用。我们大多人并不是大触，要考虑的是损失避免，损失最小化。不需要追求NHNB，在正式开始boss战前，有两拨阴阳鱼。在通常情况是必死弹幕的，然而天空璋里有季节力量，你在恰当的机会使用盾来保护自己，就可以免于死亡和炸B。

嗯。。尽力练习Hard混关ing...

36685259.review:
Juegazo!
como es costumbre este es otro touhou exelente, con buenos modos de disparos y bastante entretenido

Graficos: muchos stages son coloridos y usan efectos 3D prerenderizado, aunque para ser honesto muchas de las texturas parecen imagenes sacadas de google, y los dibujos de los personajes es muy del estilo de ZUN, por lo que se puede perdonar

Presentacion: es touhou, la historia es lo que menos importa, sacrifica la historia que esta medio meh por buenos controles.
ahora con respecto a la dificultad, para algunos que no vieron touhou todavia, es cierto que los patrones pueden imprecionar, pero creeme que se aprende rapido, este es un "touhou facil" el truco es mirar alrdedor tuyo y no mirar al jefe.

Musica: aca es donde touhou 16 brilla, la musica es exelente, ademas de trompetas, podemos escuchar clarinetes, oboes, pianos, etc, pero lo que mas destaca aqui es la inclucion de guitarras electricas, ZUN ya ha incluido este instrumento en anteriores juego con resultados bastante crudos, en este juego la calidad las guitarras es bastante impresionante (notese en el ultimo nivel por ejemplo) tengan encuenta que ZUN usa un modulo MIDI y no una verdadera guitarra electrica, que haya logrado que las guitarras suenen bien es todo un logro

Controles: los controles son mas que pulidos y sensillos, con Z disparas, con X usas la bomba, y con C usas una especie de mini-bomba circular muy util para sacarte de algunos apuros

36680955.review:
Touhou w końcu trafiło na steam. Pora również na wszystkie pozostałe części ;) All hail Zun!

W skrócie, Hidden Star in Four Seasons to znakomity bullet hell, z 4 wyraźnie rózniącymi się postaciami (klasycznie Reimu i Marisa, do tego Aya i Opalona :D Cirno), z czego każda może być w 2 nieco różniących się trybach, i znakomitym, dającym wyzwanie gameplayem. Dla nieobeznanych - kierowana przez nas postać leci do przodu, likwiduje dziesiątki przeciwników i zbiera to co z nich wypadnie, do tego regularnie mierzy się z kolejnymi bossami. Bossowie zaś zalewają ekran setkami pocisków, które trzeba omijać. W sumie podobne do shmupów Cave, które od niedawna też są regularnie wydawane na steamie. Do tego całość okraszona piękną muzyką i budzącymi uśmiech rysunkami Zuna (które z kolei są podstawą do pięknych fanowskich artworków).

W Hidden Star in Four Seasons zasadniczo wszystko działa dobrze. Nie jest to może najlepsza część touhou (za którą uważam Perfect Cherry Blossom, albo Imperishable Night), jednak grało mi się świetnie. Polecam. Jedyny problem w grze to japońskie krzaczki - trzeba się nieco pomęczyć, by mieć fanowską angielską wersję i cieszyć się radośnie głupkowatą fabułą gdzie główną rolę odgrywają pory roku.

36676286.review:
——樱花舞落的博丽神社。
　　这场景放在平时可是美到值得大开一场宴会的。
　　但是今年不同。没有任何人造访。
　　魔理沙“好热啊”
　　灵梦 “你怎么穿成这个样子”
　　魔理沙“魔法之森可是在下雪喔”
　　魔理沙穿着一身寒冬的打扮。
　　灵梦 “现在明明这么春意盎然嘛。开个赏花会怎么样”
　　魔理沙“随你的便啦，不过只有你这边开着樱花嘞。
　　大概是因为日照充足吧”
　　？？？“哎呀，这里开着樱花……？”
　　现身的是天狗新闻记者，射命丸文。
　　文　 “虽然我曾听说在接连几天回暖的秋日里
　　也可能会有樱花盛开……”
　　灵梦 “还不明白是什么原因，不过这里已经有一段时日是这种感觉了。
　　并不仅仅是樱花，连蜂斗菜都开始发芽了呀。”
　　文　 “嗯——……。啊，我想起来有点急事就先回去了”
　　文匆匆忙忙地离开了。
　　魔理沙“那家伙什么情况呀。来干啥的”
　　灵梦 “应该是来调查最近的异常气象。似乎不是单纯的自然现象呢。
　　正如天狗所探知到的，这就是异变吧。”
　　灵梦开始采取行动的时候，幻想乡已经被缤纷的四季景色所浸染。
　　这是时值仲夏的故事。

[h1]과거 첫 씹덕질을 시작하게 된 작품.[/h1] 

이 게임은 일단 추천부터 박고 간다.
일단 분위기는 100년 전통 가마솥 사골국처럼 찌인하게 다스린 일뽕을 담고 있다.
하지만 주목해야 하는 점은 게임 캐릭터에 따른 개성있는 탄막이다.

일뽕이 사골탕이라면 탄막은 석박지다. 사골탕도 존나 맛있고 석박지도 존나 맛있다. 그래 씨발 그냥 다 좋다.

다만 내가 세월이 흘러서 그런지 손 쉽게 클리어하던 하드모드도 이젠 버겁다.
갑자기 스팀에 출시하니 약 7년 전 시작한 동덕질이 오랜만에 떠올랐다. 기념으로 맹월초 정주행 간다.

36669598.review: 作为系列第16作，本作的难度安排较为普通。在弹幕风格上与以前有较大差异，不同于以前的华丽设计风格，这次的弹幕明显较为简朴，一是因为ZUN近年比较忙，作品制作周期短，所以在这方面减少了一些功夫，二是他应该早就有了这种转变风格的想法，这一点从上一作东方绀珠传中可以看出。至于文化背景的考据上，依然像往常一样丰富，比如使用了对于大家都很陌生的这个“璋”字，个人猜测是作者从古代考据所了解到的祭祀器具的名称，并且显然与季节、星象相关。总之，这次的作品是一次稳定普通的发挥。请大家一边饮酒一边享受这次的游戏。

36669336.review:
一面：你说我我一个好好的蝴蝶，怎么就被钦定成黑幕呢
二面：社会你欢姐，人狠话不多
三面：是从韩国来的会讲经的浮莲子呢
四面：你老公真棒.JPG
五面：幻想乡好舞蹈比惨大会成员
六面：你以为我是纯狐，其实是我dio哒
EX面：其他六面做得到吗
音乐是东方系列的灵魂，很神奇的一点是zun的音乐风格无法被简单概括，但当你听到时能听出这是他的作品。而且很多音乐在刚开始时不觉得好听，但是通过游戏体验人物故事的了解，其旋律早熟记于心，例如心之所在或哈德曼（某星条旗不算）。可以说zun的音乐是为游戏服务的，弹幕、敌机、背景、剧情发展所带动的气氛和情绪，基本上都是在音乐的基础上创作的，可以说如果没有音乐，东方只不过是一个有世界观的普通stg系列而已，所以只有通过游戏才能体会到原曲的魅力，而音乐正是东方魅力的主要体现。在此不讨论同人音乐。
在故事背景方面与很多不断扩大世界观作品不一样，东方的世界舞台仅仅限于幻想乡、月都和现世密封组，并通过异变的发生不断丰富成熟内容，而且你在玩游戏时会发现哪怕游戏通关，也无法完全明白它讲了什么故事，zun在很多设定方面会留有空白，比如一些人物关系，一些异变所导致的“剧情分支”等，供人无限遐想，产生各种二次设定，而且东方很多的故事都有一个特点，就是它以一个凄凉严肃的往事作为原因，但在游戏过程中却是轻松遐逸的，大家都在遵守符卡规则，就像玩游戏一样（纯狐：？？？）。可见zun想创造一个令人向往的包容的幻想乡，没有实力论，没有绝对正反派，一切的一切就像是打发无聊的日常，最后在少女们的绚丽的烟火中结束。可能这种心情也是我们最初玩游戏的心情吧。
作为东方众，我不会在意天空璋的bug和瞎眼，因为我等的不是游戏本身的游戏性，而是zun给我们游戏之外的新探索，这恐怕是很多游戏难以做到的。
对于路人，我选择推荐，并不止天空璋，而是东方本身，单单一个天空璋是很难入坑的，我也希望东方能有更多的作品能在steam上出售。
感谢zun。

价格只有50元，相比起预测来说低了很多了；
E难度非常亲民，上手很简单，城管强无敌，手残大欢喜；
音乐好听，节奏性强，算是东方游戏一贯的魅力所在了；
新的角色很可爱，而且进一步丰富了东方幻想乡的世界观；
由于steam受众比较多，预测二次创作会更多，可喜可贺；
steam平台玩家都是真心喜欢玩游戏的，在这里你可以交到更多志同道合的朋友，自己不再孤单（起码以后可以找人开黑了）；
有汉化，再次感谢汉化组所做的一切。
